author: Chao Deng
title: Rejections Pile Up for Chinese Firms Seeking Listings at Home
text:
BEIJING—Chinese companies trying to list shares on China’s stock exchanges are hitting a roadblock, as regulators tighten approvals, rejecting applications in droves.
The securities regulator has tightened its standards on initial public offerings in recent months, scrutinizing candidates’ reported profits and disclosures, according to investment bankers and analysts. Its powerful vetting committee is on notice that its members will be held responsible if approved companies turn out to be duds.
